Trade/Device Name(s): CDC Human Influenza Virus Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel
Submitter Information: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Regulation Name(s): Reagents for detection of specific novel influenza A viruses
Respiratory viral panel multiplex nucleic acid assay
Instrumentation for clinical multiplex test systems
Analyte(s): Influenza A subtypes: seasonal A/H1, A/H3, A/H1pdm09, A/H5
Instrument(s)/Platform(s): Applied Biosystems (ABI) 7500 Fast Dx Real-Time PCR Instrument
Method(s)/Technology(ies): Oligonucleotide primers and dual-labeled hydrolysis (TaqMan) probes
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for CDC Human Influenza Virus Real-Time RT-PCR Diagnostic Panel for detection and subtyping of human influenza viruses from respiratory specimens
Indications for Use Summary: Qualitative detection of influenza virus A or B and subtyping of seasonal human influenza A viruses in upper and lower respiratory tract specimens and viral culture from patients with respiratory infection symptoms, including presumptive identification of A/H5 (Asian lineage) for surveillance and clinical management
